author: {'steamid': '76561198016096893', 'num_games_owned': 11947, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1490172461}
review:
Вы когда нибудь играли в волейбол используя сазана вместо мяча? Нет? И теперь настал тот момент когда вы сможете это сделать :) Данный "вид спорта", конечно не волейбол, но немного схож с ним. Один или несколько (до 4х человек) находитесь на площадке, ваша задача отбивать "снаряд" с помошью досок на руках и не дать ему упасть на пол, так же выскочить за пределы площадки.

Веселая игра в соревновательном духе, в который вы сможете на славу повеселиться со своими друзьями.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181754010', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1481347018}
review:
Tomado de [b][url=http://citagamer.com]CitaGamer[/url][/b], los mejores juegos para jugar en pareja.

[h1] Don’t Drop The Bass es un divertido juego casual en 2-D que te divertirá por horas, pero recuerda… hagas lo que hagas, ¡no dejes caer el pescado![/h1]

[b]Modalidades de juego en pareja:[/b]
[list]
[*]Cooperativo Local / Local Coop
 [*]Multiplayer Local / Local Multiplayer
[/list]
[b]Lo que opinó Él:[/b]

El Don’t Drop the Bass es un juego sumamente sencillo, ideal para perder el tiempo con tu pareja si les gustan los jueguitos tontos y sin sentido.

[b]Lo que opinó Ella:[/b]

Recomiendo este juego a aquellas personas que tienen poco tiempo para jugar, ya que es un juego casual y lo pueden jugar en pocos minutos. También a aquellas personas que disfrutan competir con sus parejas o amigos ya que este juego se presta mucho para eso y para molestar a tu compañero/a.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062232099', 'num_games_owned': 5821, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1470216788}
review:
[h1]What is Don't Drop the Bass?[/h1]

As an only child growing up I would create different games in order to keep myself amused. It's also part of the reason why I'm such a computer game nerd but that's another story. One of the games that I played was tapping a balloon, a ball, or anything that would have reasonable air time. I would try and keep it from touching the ground for as long as possible. I imagined that there was a world championship of some sort and that I was always trying to qualify. It was stupid and mindless fun. As a result, I always ways to alleviate boredom. I never expected that one day I would find a similar game on Steam. Don't Drop the Bass is exactly that. It is in Steam Early Access and is being developed and published by RadishBox.

[b]Simple Mindless Fun[/b]

The best part of Don't Drop the Bass is that it doesn't take much thought to play. It's very simple. Simply maneuver your dude around the screen and stop the bass fish hitting the floor. Events take place throughout the game that stifles concentration due to distraction. As a result, those who will be most successful will be those able to sustain concentration for the longest. It's a very simple game and is presented in that manner.

[b]Party Game[/b]

I haven't played the multiplayer version of the game. I know, I know. Part of me is still that lonely only child who had to find ways to entertain themselves when I couldn't spend time with my friends. But that's okay because come September our house will be full for a week and we'll be looking for games such as this to play. It's another game that is very accessible to younger players who I think will get a real kick out of it.

There are several multiplayer modes that can take up to four players. These include the co-op mode where anyone can save the fish from hitting the ground at any time; Roulette Versus Mode is a competitive mode where you have to keep the fish in the air on your turn and attack your opponents on theirs; and Slap Versus mode where the object is to slap the fish the most amount of times in a set time period.

[h1]Presentation[/h1]

[b]Graphics[/b]

The graphics are well presented and cartoony. However, I do have one issue with them. From time to time I found it difficult in knowing where and when the fish was going to drop. It seems like you have hit gotten into the right position but then you are notified that you have lost a life. This becomes really aggravating and is the one true frustration that I have with the game. I'd like to see this cleaned up and worked on throughout the lifetime of the game being in Early Access period

[b]Sound[/b]

The sound presently in the game is catchy and fitting with the atmosphere and mood of the game. There isn't anything more that needs to be noted about the sound.

[h1]Is it Steamified?[/h1]

Not yet. The game hasn't got trading cards or Steam achievements. It also fails to use any of the other potential features of Steam.

I'd like to see the game utilize the Steam leaderboard system. The game has already got 'record times' set into the gameplay. It wouldn't take very much effort to incorporate the leaderboard system. As a result of the leaderboard system a competitive spirit could evolve with the game as players see who can the bass from dropping for the longest.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

Don't Drop the Bass is an enjoyable game that has rekindled childhood memories of the games I used to play to keep myself entertained. The presentation is cartoon-like and adds to the fun of the game. It has potential to be a very solid casual party game and is suitable for all ages.

For similar reviews and our popular giveaways (including hardware) please visit [url=http://www.steamified.com]Steamified[/url].
